description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 1.1.2.7 Configure /var/log/audit

controls.title: Ensure separate partition exists for /var/log/audit
controls.description: The /var/log/audit directory is used by the audit daemon to store audit records. Separating /var/log/audit from the root filesystem ensures that processes cannot exhaust all available space on the root filesystem.
controls.remediation: Create a separate partition for /var/log/audit and add it to /etc/fstab

controls.title: Ensure nodev option set on /var/log/audit partition
controls.description: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices. This prevents device files from being created in /var/log/audit.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nodev to the mount options for /var/log/audit

controls.title: Ensure nosuid option set on /var/log/audit partition
controls.description: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files. This prevents setuid files from being executed from /var/log/audit.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nosuid to the mount options for /var/log/audit

controls.title: Ensure noexec option set on /var/log/audit partition
controls.description: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries. This prevents executable files from being executed from /var/log/audit.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add noexec to the mount options for /var/log/audit
